channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How Meta Distanced Itself From Politics
item.description: Ahead of November’s election, Meta has de-emphasized political content on Facebook, Instagram and Threads and doesn’t want to talk about candidates or...

item.title: U.N. General Assembly: U.N. Live Updates: After Biden Warns of ‘Inflection Point’ in Global Turmoil, Many Leaders Focus on Israel
item.description: In his final U.N. speech, President Biden delivered a message of hope that wars in Ukraine, the Middle East and Sudan could end. Other world leaders c...

item.title: Harris leads Trump by over 30 points among young voters: poll
item.description: The poll showed Harris leading Trump 64% to 32% among young likely voters in a two-way hypothetical match up.

item.title: U.S. Accuses Visa of Monopoly in Debit Cards
item.description: The financial giant, which processes the majority of debit card spending in the United States, unfairly imposed fees on merchants and deterred rivals,...

item.title: Russia Signs Satellite Deal With Three West African Military Governments
item.description: The partnership between Russia’s space agency and the governments of Burkina Faso, Mali and Niger deepens these countries’ turn toward the Kremlin in ...

item.title: Goldman’s Kostin predicts S&P 500 reaching 6,000 mark
item.description: The firm’s chief US equity strategist expects the S&P 500 Index to trade around the 6,000 level a year from now.

item.title: Larry Hogan Has a Theory About the Maryland Senate Race
item.description: How party control of the Senate may come down to Maryland Democrats taking a big gamble.

item.title: Live Updates: Thousands Flee Southern Lebanon, as Israel Presses Air Attack on Hezbollah
item.description: Lebanese health officials said Israeli attacks since Monday have killed hundreds, including women and children. Israel claimed it had killed one senio...

item.title: Want to be a tech company? Build with value in mind
item.description: To become a tech company, you need to deploy tech in a way that boosts profits and performance. There are four ingredients for getting there.

item.title: Baldwin, With Shapiro in Tow, Looks For ‘Trump-Tammy Voters’ in Wisconsin
item.description: The Democratic senator, who is seeking a third term in a politically competitive state, rallied with the Pennsylvania governor, who has a track record...

item.title: Families of Hostages and Gazans Feel Forgotten as War Heats Up in Lebanon
item.description: Talks to reach a potential cease-fire in Gaza and free the remaining 100 or so hostages have stalled.

item.title: Prince Harry takes on social media giants over youth mental health crisis
item.description: “This is not free will," Harry said.

item.title: Hemmed In by the Hard Right, Johnson Again Turns to Democrats for Votes
item.description: The House speaker is trying to get a short-term spending agreement passed despite opposition from some conservative members of his own party.

item.title: Israel’s Strikes on Lebanon Are Some of the Deadliest in Decades: What to Know
item.description: What we know about the strikes, the death toll and how it is calculated.

item.title: Brett Favre reveals Parkinson’s diagnosis during hearing on welfare funds scandal
item.description: Parkinson's disease is a progressive disorder that affects the nervous system and causes nerve cells to weaken in parts of the brain.
